alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 1:03AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Smyth and southwestern Grayson Counties through 130 AM EDT... At 103 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Adwolf, or near Chilhowie, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Saltville... Chilhowie... Whitetop... Sugar Grove... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... and Troutdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
